column1: Narrator : The boat docks right in front of a forest. No sandy beach to be seen.

column2: Choice : Let’s take a look a these woods

column4: Narrator : The night is too dark, it would be dangerous to go any further without light.

column1: Narrator : An especially huge tree stands in the middle on the wood.

column5: Narrator : The smooth bark of the tree makes it very slippery. CAPITAINE will have to use their climbing skills.

column1: Choice : Let’s check the rest of the forest.

column7: Narrator : While climbing, CAPITAINE slips and falls back down, on their back.

column6: PlayerSpeak : At last, here I am!

column1: PlayerSpeak : This is breathtaking! Worth the climb!

column4: PlayerSpeak : I don’t have a spyglass...

column1: Narrator : The sun shines through the branches of the pine trees, lighting the only navigable path in front of CAPITAINE. The vegetation is too thick to go anywhere else.
column2: Narrator : The night is clear and mild in these pine woods. The thick vegetation leaves only one option for CAPITAINE, a little path meandering trough the trees and bushy thickets.
column4: Narrator : After walking through dense vegetation, it's almost like CAPITAINE can breath again when they emerge in a beautiful clearing. To go further, they can choose between a trail along a loud stream of water, or a path covered with dead leaves.
column5: Narrator : The moonlight illuminates a quiet clearing. After walking through the dark forest for a while, it feels like a real breath of fresh air to CAPITAINE! To go further, they can choose between a trail along a loud stream of water, or a path covered with dead leaves.
column8: Narrator : Massive oak trees stand against the blue sky, so tall it’s almost impossible to see the top. CAPITAINE reaches a crossroads, faced with a choice of four paths.
column9: Narrator : Hard to see in the darkness of the night, but CAPITAINE seems to be in a forest made of very tall trees. They reach a crossroad and have to choose between the four paths in front of them.
column13: Narrator : The forest was much smaller than it seemed from the boat. CAPITAINE reaches the end of it and the beach on the other side.
column14: Narrator : The moonlight shines on the still forest in the mild night air. It's a peaceful place, but there’s nothing to do here really...

column2: Narrator : On the dirt trail, CAPITAINE can smell the mouthwatering scent of food wafting in the air. A wooden sign reads « Fresh ale & juicy meat »
column3: Narrator : Vulgar laughs and metal clinks echo through the wood. CAPITAINE doesn’t like this, it sounds like trouble.
column4: Narrator : Vulgar laughs and metal clinks echo through the wood. CAPITAINE doesn’t like this, it sounds like trouble.
column5: Narrator : The sound of hammers and saws reaches CAPITAINE's ears, as they approach what looks like a boat workshop.
column6: Narrator : CAPITAINE bumps into a vast sandy beach. Behind some dunes, a small ship is wrecked on rocks.
column7: Narrator : A little path leads CAPITAINE to a cove. Someone lives here.
column8: Narrator : The seemingly narrow path deepens CAPITAINE into the woods. He is, yet again, surrounded by trees and bushes. How big is this forest ?
column9: Narrator : A little path leads CAPITAINE to a cove. Someone lives here.

column15: Narrator : The path was much shorter than it seemed from the middle of the forest. CAPITAINE reaches a wonderful sun lit clearing, and there’s nowhere else to go but back
column16: Narrator : The path was much shorter than it seemed from the middle of the forest. CAPITAINE reaches a moon lit clearing, and there’s nowhere else to go but back

column3: Narrator : Vulgar laughs and metal clinks echo through the wood. CAPITAINE doesn’t like this, it sounds like trouble.

column7: Narrator : CAPITAINE finds his way back to the first corner of the woods he visited.

column1: Narrator : Before wandering further in the forest, CAPITAINE notices very descreet path, he strangely didn’t notice before.
column4: Narrator : Before wandering back to NOMBATEAU, CAPITAINE notices very descreet, but definetly intented path.

column1: Narrator : In truth, it seems the trail is more and more obvious, as CAPITAINE takes note of it.
column4: Narrator : In truth, it seems the trail is more and more obvious, as CAPITAINE takes note of it.

column1: Narrator : The branches and leaves almost convey the impression of opening before CAPITAINE. It’s truly magic.
column4: Narrator : The branches and leaves almost convey the impression of opening before CAPITAINE. It’s truly magic.

column2: Choice : (carry on to the first intended path)
column5: Choice : (continue to the ship and leave) (leave)

column1: Narrator : CAPITAINE starts strolling down the beautiful path.
Narrator : It now seems like half a day CAPITAINE roves through the forest. Yet the path is so peaceful, he didn’t even notice.
Narrator : CAPITAINE is suddenly stopped by an immense stone, covered in moss.
PlayerSpeak : This might be the point where I go back.
Narrator : In a bizarre twist of events, it took only what seemed like seconds for CAPITAINE to get back to his boat…
column2: Narrator : CAPITAINE continues down the trail
Narrator : It’s now night time and CAPITAINE doesn’t even feel any kind of fatigue…
Narrator : But wait… A colossal tree rises from the woodland. It’s aura is almost celestial and it is covered in strange markings.
Narrator : CAPITAINE recognizes most of the words. It’s undeniably « NOMTRESOR » and variation of it. There’s is a recuring word CAPITAINE does’t understand though…
PlayerSpeak : From what I can make out…
PlayerSpeak : Better take not of this.
Choice : Let’s leave this strange place !
